com.jgaap.gui.guiComponents
Class StepProgressIndicator

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  com.jgaap.gui.guiComponents.StepProgressIndicator
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class StepProgressIndicator
extends javax.swing.JPanel

Simple class that extends JPanel and represents a single step of a multi-step process. The class allows for an unlimited number of steps, and will change its visual layout appropriately.

Author:
Chuck Liddell
See Also:
Serialized Form

stepNames

private java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> stepNames
Array of step names to be displayed. The progress indicator will be dynamically created and sized to fit the step names (within reason).

currentStep

private int currentStep
Keeps track of which step is currently active. Numbering starts at zero.
